title: Spree Of Shark Attacks Prompts Calls For Emergency Kits On All Aussie Beaches | 10 News+
description: Should emergency shark bite kits be installed at all Aussie beaches?  A local NSW surfer who designed ‘community shark bite kits’ after two of his mates were attacked says these potentially lifesaving kits should be rolled out along the coast.  The call comes after a recent spree of shark attacks in NSW. title: Coalition In Turmoil After Resignations, Trump Heads To Davos, Skin Cancer Vaccine | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – the future of the coalition is in doubt after all Nationals MPs quit the shadow ministry, following a dispute over the hate speech laws. Donald Trump is headed to Davos as tensions between the US and Europe continue to mount, the latest on the shark attacks across New South Wales and why tourists are avoiding America this year. title: Coalition In Chaos After Eight Nationals MPs Quit Shadow Ministry In Protest | 10 News
description: The Coalition is yet again on the brink of a breakup, with the entire Nationals team quitting the shadow ministry late this evening after a shambolic day in Parliament. For Sussan Ley it could spell the end of her leadership. title: Trump: 'I Will Not Use Force' To Acquire Greenland | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump, during his speech at the World Economic Forum in Switzerland, said he will not use force in his bid to control Greenland, but reiterated that no other country can secure the Danish territory.  Trump went on to say that the land's "raw earth" is not the reason the United States' is seeking to acquire the land, telling business and political leaders that the sole purpose of the acquisition would be for strategic national and international security.  "You can say yes, and we will be very appreciative. Or you can say no, and we will remember," Trump said on Wednesday, January 21. NATO leaders have previously warned that his Greenland strategy could upend the alliance, but NATO's Secretary-General Mark Rutte did concede that more needs to be done to defend the Arctic, where China and Russia are "increasingly active". title: Nationals Leader David Littleproud Announces Split Of ‘Untenable’ Coalition | 10 News
description: Nationals Leader David Littleproud says the Coalition is "untenable" following the mass exodus of the entire Nationals frontbench in the Shadow Ministry overnight.  Mr Littleproud said the Coalition is "done", and that none of his MPs would be willing to rejoin a shadow ministry led by Sussan Ley if senators cannot have a "difference of opinion".  The walk-out was in solidarity with the trio of senators forced to resign after aligning against the Shadow Cabinet's position and crossing the floor against Labor’s hate speech laws.  Mr Littleproud said the exodus could have been avoided, had Ley agreed to have the senators reinstated. Ms Ley will not comment on the Coalition split until tomorrow, given it is the National Day of Mourning honouring the Bondi terror attack. title: Several Missing After Landslide Hits Mount Maunganui Campsite In New Zealand | 10 News
description: Several people are unaccounted for after a slip near a campsite in Mount Maunganui on New Zealand’s North Island.  Emergency services were called to the Beachside Holiday Park on Adams Ave around 9:30am after a landslide hit the site.  It’s among some significant slips on The Mount overnight as a result of severe weather lashing the country.  The campsite has been evacuated, and surrounding streets closed as emergency services work to locate anybody who remains in the area. title: Valtteri Bottas In Budgy Smuggler Bike Ride | 10 Sport

title: Albanese Marks National Day Of Mourning For Bondi Victims | 10 News
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has invited the nation to participate in a minute’s silence at 7:01pm this evening to mark the National Day of Mourning, remembering the 15 victims of the Bondi anti-Semitic terror attack.  Flags will be flown at half mast on State and Commonwealth buildings, and a national commemorative installation titled ‘Fifteen Pillars of Light’ will be lit up at various locations across the country.  Australians are also encouraged to light a candle on their windowsill or doorstep as an act of remembrance, and undertake an act of kindness – or ‘mitzvah’ – to bring light after darkness.  #10News #Bondi #BondiAttack #NationalDayOfMourning  Join the conversation and follow us on: TikTok: http://www.tiktok.com/@10NewsAU/ Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/10NewsAU/ Twitter: http://twitter.com/10NewsAU Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/10NewsAU/  10 News airs at 5pm, seven nights a week in your local market on Network 10. Missed the bulletin? Catch up at https://10.com.au/news  10 News is based in Australia and is a division of Paramount.

title: Multiple Missing In NZ Landslide, Barnaby On Coalition Split, National Day Of Mourning | 10 News+
description: An Australian father and son speak out on the terrifying landslide in New Zealand, as multiple people, including children, remain missing.  Barnaby Joyce breaks his silence on the mass exodus of National Party frontbenchers from the Federal Shadow Cabinet and the subsequent split of the coalition under Sussan Ley.  Today, Australia marks a National Day of Mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack. title: Australia Marks National Day Of Mourning For Bondi Beach Terror Attack Victims | 10 News
description: Today, Australia marks a National Day of Mourning for the victims of the Bondi terror attack.  15 people were killed after two gunmen opened fire on a Jewish event at Bondi Beach on the 14th of December.  Flags across the country are at half-mast and tonight a memorial service will take place with national institutions illuminating in symbols of light.
